meanings.definition: Flehm (verb): To grimace or make a facial expression of disgust or disapproval.
meanings.sent1: She flehmed when she saw the spoiled milk.
meanings.sent2: He always flehms when he hears bad news.
meanings.sent3: The baby made a little flehm at the taste of the medicine.
meanings.sent4: His face flehmed like a crumpled paper bag.
meanings.sent5: The smell was so awful that it made her flehm uncontrollably.

meanings.definition: Flehm (noun): A facial expression of disgust or disapproval.
meanings.sent1: Her flehm was evident when she saw the mess in the kitchen.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's flehm showed her disappointment in the students' behavior.
meanings.sent3: His exaggerated flehm made everyone laugh at the party.
meanings.sent4: The painting captured the essence of a silent flehm.
meanings.sent5: The movie villain's flehm sent shivers down the audience's spines.
